website_summaries.verdict: Start-up companies and work-from-home operations on limited budgets will get nearly the same quality at half the price of most two-line speakerphones. If you need a lot of phones for a call center or sales department, this is one to consider.
pros: Surprising number of professional phone features for such an affordable price
Large LCD display is easy to read and provides complete Caller ID information
cons: Does not have a built-in answering machine
Limited number of functions compared to professional level office phones
Back-up memory system tends to drain batteries quickly

customer_reviews.title: The reception/call quality on this is terrible. At first I thought it was because I ...
customer_reviews.text: The reception/call quality on this is terrible. At first I thought it was because I am using magic jack, but no.... It was suggested to me to try another phone, also the same price, and that one was perfect. With this you can most of the time hear the person on the other line, but they can't really hear you. Either they can hear every other word or will tell you it sounds like your underwater. There's also tons of static. I don't recommend this at all, and make sure you read the reviews and pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good features; Good Value in a SOHO office phone
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why the negativity on some previous reviews. This is a GREAT home office desk phone. Sounds clear on handset or speaker, and folks I speak to on this phone have agreed. Phone has a decent number of speed dial storage slots (dual layer); nice volume control and all the other features one would expect on a phone of this type. If I had to really dig for a criticism, I would say the hand receiver is a little light. No problem giving this phone a 5-star, especially for the cost/value.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Walleigh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I needed something immediately because I work from home and my other phone got damaged in a recent move. This was cheap (bought a cosmetic return) and easy ish. Does what I need it to, has the 2.5 jack. Only thing is that the head/handset thing has to be plugged in for the 2.5 headset to work properly. Kind of annoying but still way better than my Cortelco. Mute doesnt have an audible click and sound is pretty loud. Runs off batteries only and phone cord. Will update if something goes wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Avery Commons

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic phone that offers memory dialing in addition to 20 pre sets. Most importantly the display shows if you have voice mail along with stutter dial tone VM alert. Ring volume and handset volume can be adjusted. The handset cord can be replaced with a longer cord if needed. It was a little tricky setting up. I thought that the "OK" button was not working at first, however, there is a very specific sequence used when entering information; when followed, the OK function worked fine. Only wish there was a choice of ring tone but other than that.....satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for emergencies for when the power goes out. Very disappointed with the quality, sound is not clear and then after a year it started malfunctioning- whenever someone would call it would short out and the line would go dead after one ring. We thought it was a problem with our phone line but it turned out the problem was with this phone. Very disappointed; we have had many Panasonic cordless phones over the years which never had any problems. No one makes a decent corded phone anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Died One Day after Return Window Closed!
customer_reviews.text: It too 31 days for the phone to fail -- erased all the numbers I'd had programmed in, and it stopped switching between headset and handset with the button. Fortunately, Amazon took it back, even though it was one day past the return window. Now I'm back on line, trying to find a phone with the specs I need. All of them seem to have issues or lack a headset jack. Grrr.
customer_reviews.author: Thea Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good phone with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: Good phone. Speaker phone is an improvement over the phone it replaced on my desk. One small disappointment is that instead of having one button for speaker phone and another for headset, those two use the same button. If the headset is plugged in, then the speakerphone and telephone handset are not functional. My prior phone let me switch between headset and speaker phone by pressing their respective buttons, and the handset was activated just by picking it up. I liked that better since I did not have to unplug the headset in order to be able to use the handset or speaker phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: save your money
customer_reviews.text: i thought this phone would be perfect for my home office so i threw the packing away, no box should have told me something. a week later i set it up and picked up the handset , nothing not a single noise. tried my headset nothing , i tried the Speaker and nothing. i have never ran across a phone that you don’t get a dial told of any kind. I won’t be buying anymore phones or headsets from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Harwell

customer_reviews.title: excellent home office desk phone
customer_reviews.text: I mostly work from home and needed something for my conf calls that some of them take long and Bluetooth headphones and cell phones dont cut it so I had to get a desk phone with wired headset that goes with it. I needed at least "redial", "speaker", "mute", "volume" and some kind of LCD display and this has them all. very happy with the product and price was not that expensive so does my needs more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: good, but cheaper elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: 1. I did notice this same model for about half the price I paid on Amazon. it is a good phone. works better than an ATT land line phone I replaced with this phone. I love this phone for what I use it for. it is easier to set up speed dial numbers on this phone. this phone has a much better sounding, factory setting on the ring tone.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Gilbert III

customer_reviews.title: 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last Panasonic office phone in 1992. It made it until just recently. This phone lasted a couple of months. The Caller ID first started not displaying any phone numbers in the log once a new call had come in. Then the Caller ID then quit showing the incoming number. I had enough this morning as the speakerphone stopped working, it's now sitting at the bottom of my trash can. I may have just gotten a lemon, but c'mon.
customer_reviews.author: ClayG420

customer_reviews.title: very good product overall
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for the money, and I'm glad I bought it. It works well and has very useful features. There was, however, a period of initial frustration getting it programmed. It didn't do what the manual said it would do. I kept trying different things and somehow accidentally did something that caused it to start working properly. After that it was easy to program and use. Also, its features are not fully documented and a little experimentation is helpful. If you don't mind an initial learning curve, you will probably like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Was a great phone for the price ...then I used it for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE, 04/2016: The handset has completely stopped working and the phone now only works in speakerphone mode or with a headset. Contacted Panasonic and was advised the ENTIRE phone would need to be shipping to a repair center. Original, 11/2015: Simple and does what the box says, make and receive calls haha. BIG plus is the headset jack on the side, which I forgot I needed and was super STOKED to see it there! No power cable needed, just insert AA batteries and plug phone wire in, BOOM you have phone.
customer_reviews.author: Nate KW

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in August and replaced it in February with the ATT (2 line phone). The phone would break in and out whether using the handset or a headset. Several times during business calls, I had to hang up and call back on my cell phone. It wasn't a problem with my service since all my other phones in the house had no problems. I just purchased the ATT 2 line corded phone (even though I only need one line) and it works great, Calls are very clear and there is no cutting in and out. Recommend you spend a little more for the ATT phone - you will be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Can't seen the screen even with batteries in it. Screen doesn't light. Does not come with a power cord. Hanging up the phone doesn't always disconnect the call. Speaker phone cannot be used without first taking the phone handset off its base. Only reason I'm keeping it is because returning items are a hassle. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Headset outgoing volume is too low
customer_reviews.text: My purchased this September 2015. The volume to the caller when I use the hand set is fine, however when I'm using hands-free with a headset, the person I'm calling can hardly hear me. I have to pull the microphone directly in front of my mouth which pulls the ear part off my ear. I bought the recommended headset when I bought the phone and just recently tried a different headset which also has the same issue . I have a new, very expensive headset coming tomorrow. Hopefully, that will make a difference or at least have an outgoing volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly just barely good enough is the quality standard
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems to work well; however, the display does not have a backlight or illumination of any kind. Also the display characters are small and appear at the lower edge of the display window. The two position desk mount capability is a cumbersome operation that I gave up on. This is my third desk phone, the prior phones were purchased from a different manufacturer the dialing pads/key boards on these went south. Seemingly just barely good enough is the quality standard.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: My unit would not program. It's replacement also would not program.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a perfect corded phone - if it worked. According to the manual, the device should power up after adding batteries with the command "Set time & date". It didn't. Pressing the "Program" button had no effect. I ordered a replacement - same problems. Panasonic does not offer customer support on this item, so I've had to return both phones. This is the first faulty Panasonic phone I've experienced in thirty plus years. I hope their quality isn't slipping like SONY's did.
customer_reviews.author: Minnmaven

customer_reviews.title: Works for Mom
customer_reviews.text: Needed a land line phone for my mother who is in early stages of Alzheimer's. I programmed numbers of family and listed them on the side, She is able to punch the button beside the name and make the call. Prior to this she had gotten to the point she could not remember how to operate her iPhone. She is in assisted living, so this phone has worked well since she really does not need a cell phone anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Slvrstang

customer_reviews.title: 4 months and still working great
customer_reviews.text: This is our main landline phone and I'm happy to say that it has been a good buy for us. The only downside is a shorter cord from the base unit to the hand piece. We tried exchanging it with the cord on our other phone, but no luck with that. As it is, it serves our needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: P. Banks

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a total piece of junk (along with the recommended headset).
customer_reviews.text: Died after 12.5 months. Sent to Panasonic and they offered to fix my $40 phone for $86. Tried to use it with the "recommended" headset and everybody I tried to talk to either says they cannot hear me, or that I sounded very tinny. I think this is a total piece of junk (along with the recommended headset).
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: I needed a phone with adequate speaker volume and long backup battery life.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker volume is excellent. As far as I can tell so far, the backup battery life is also good. Backing up a solid state contacts memory should not rapidly deplete a set of batteries in two or three months. The batteries should last for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D. Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Phone
customer_reviews.text: Good for a SLT I am using this on a Panasonic phone system as just a analog extension it works well but the instructions were not very clear on how to set the darn clock on it. Google helped with that lol. I chose this phone because it looks pretty close to the other phones in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be heard, I would not order this even for free
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible phone. People cannot hear me well on the other side unless I almost bite the handset in my mouth while yelling. Speakerphone is useless. I have to pick up handset if I want to be heard. I threw away the phone and replace it. I am surprised that such a piece of non-functional device is being sold with Panasonic name.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: KX-TS880 INTEGRATED PHONE SYSTEM Another great Panasonic Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big panasonic fan from way way back. All of the panasonic products i own from 1976-2012 still work the way they were designed to. This phone is just another example of a quality low cost product from panasonic. I bought it to use with my VOIP high speed internet cable modem and the sound quality is perfect! The caller Id, speed dialer, call waiting, caller on hold, speaker phone and head set features all work great! It makes a great small office business phone. ML
customer_reviews.author: DR Quest

customer_reviews.title: Economical phone with a few drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: LIKE Price, styling, footprint, Panasonic brand DISLIKE Battery powered only (3 AAA) Poor speaker quality Screen not backlit, hard to see The 3 dislikes were a killer for my needs as I use this as an office phone, so I returned. I did not go any further on checking out any further functionality. Should be an ok phone for household use, garage, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Martha T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing interface. Basics work fine.
customer_reviews.text: In short, it's a disappointing, poorly-programmed phone. Storing a phone number appears temporary - as in, the stored phone number seems to disappear so the next time that person calls, it still says "Unknown". It's random. It is difficult to find the phone book, but the entire interface is sort of clunky and unintuitive. I'm not too experienced with programmable office phones, but we will certainly try a different brand for our next purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Batteries required for Caller ID to function - no AC adapter option
customer_reviews.text: The issue with this item is that it requires batteries for the caller ID to function and there is no option to plug this into home AC. The product description should be more clear about this fact. A little surprising as other phones in this category typical have an adapter and battery as a backup. Not the case here.
customer_reviews.author: djcabz

customer_reviews.title: Has battery backup.
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed, works perfectly. Has battery control. The first phone I ordered had electrical backup since the user is Amish she required battery backup.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Woodle

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently retired and took a job doing customer service at home. I was required to use a corded phone, which I hadn't had for years. This phone has been working well and doing what it said it would. For the price paid, I think it is a good product. I purchased a $10 Panasonic headset to go with it and so far everything is working great. I've been using it for about a month. For those who might wonder, I'm using it with cable internet phone service and it works without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: KTucker

customer_reviews.title: LEMON
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the "OK" button didn't work, disabling most of the product's features. Panasonic said I'd have to ship it at my expense to a repair facility, i.e. big nuisance. Now, first time I tried to use it, it's just an over-priced corded telephone eternally urging me to set the clock. Will buy such things locally from now on, so I can just take it back to the store if it proves to be a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Ozarks Hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality phone for headset user.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this phone to replace its' predecessor after 4-5 years of use. It was a Panasonic also very similar to this phone. We came to find out that the batteries had gone dead on the old phone and that is why the speakerphone/headset switch did not work any longer. So now we have two good quality speaker phones with a headset port. Teamed up with a Plantronics basic headset we get a very good hands-free phone.We expect the same quality for this phone as for the KX-T105B before this. Just remember that it has batteries as the power source for the speakerphone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed....
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for a landline phone with a headset jack connection for my home office. I was especially happy when I came across this one here. Only thing I don't like about it is, in order to use the speaker phone I have to pick up the handset and then push the speaker phone button. Other than that it works great!!! *UPDATE* The speaker phone feature will work without picking up the handset first as long as there are batteries in the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Markeitta

customer_reviews.title: Overall a pretty good deal
customer_reviews.text: My old Panasonic landline phone suddenly died so I replaced it with this model. Compared to the older model, this is about the same. It took some 2 minutes to get it up and running. But to use most features I had to struggle with the smallish Instruction manual. Still haven't been able to figure out how to set it to the "high desk" position. I wish the LCD screen had a larger font. And the ringer has the option to reduce the volume to a lower level. But I'm satisfied with this purchase - so far.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: The phone will only work on a dedicate telephone line it will not work on a Voice over IP line.
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a very good phone but unfortunately it will only function on a regular telephone line. It has many nice features but none of them will work on a voice over ip phone line like those supplied by Comcast, Charter, Att Uverse, and many others, the only thing you can do with it is make and receive calls and any simple telephone will do that job and does not cost nearly as much, so if you want all the bells and whistles buy something other than this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D.

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for wall mount
customer_reviews.text: This phone is not designed to attach to the standard wall mount plate. A template is included for drilling holes in your wall to mount, which is not acceptable to me when standard wall mounts are ubiquitous. Also, one of the two phones could not be programmed for time, date, etc. The function simply did not work.
customer_reviews.author: RBeckham

customer_reviews.title: Use with a headset, works better than others
customer_reviews.text: I purchased many phones with headset as it helps when I work at home, this with additional headsets works great. This was my second one. Very good quality with microphone and sound.
customer_reviews.author: S. French

customer_reviews.title: They can't hear me.
customer_reviews.text: On speaker they can't hear me speak. If I am asked to press a button, they can't hear that either. The phone is useless on Speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: What are the phone for a training that required corded phone and it arrived without the cord that connects to the handle to the bees and didn’t realize it until I’m ready to use the phone and had to go buy something at Walgreens which is very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Maria lima

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Phones Note the Same...
customer_reviews.text: First off, the phone was supposed to be white and it was black. The actual part of phone you hold and speak into is very like and cheap feeling. There's something with the sound.....like you have to keep saying "are you hearing me?" sorry I bought it. Panasonic was the the ony go dmodel ef
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Not good there must be better ones out there the speaker no one can hear you and it cut in and out so look for a better one
customer_reviews.author: Carmen H.

customer_reviews.title: very difficult to save to phonebook directory.
customer_reviews.text: i have used this type of phones for over 20 years, this phone has the most difficult steps to save an entry to the phone directory. that is why i want to return it for a no brainer phone
customer_reviews.author: Lagoon Power

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I work from home so I need a good phone that can work with my Plantronics headset. I've been using it a few weeks and love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: CW Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my mother who has dementia. It has allowed her to stay connected to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: I Can't Hear You
customer_reviews.text: The phone as a basic phone is ok. The trouble I have is that there is no indicator that the line is in use. The worst problem I have with this phone is the speakerphone is really, really bad. The caller is very, very faint. One of very few bad purchases I've had from Amazon. Unfortunately, I didn't really completely give up on the speakerphone issue until I could not return it. I may have just a bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: sweetbabylee

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price ,...... but.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good phone for the price. It is relatively easy to program your autodial huber and the speaker phone is loud and clear. The only thing that is annoying is the fact that there is a noticeable delay between the time that you push the button and the time that it dials. The speed dial is even slower Don't use it if you plan to be the first caller to win.... Other wise it's a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with this Panasonic Corded Phone
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this Panasonic Corded Phone. It arrived on time and in excellent condition. The best part was I was able to use it as a wall phone in my kitchen. The installation was quick and easy. To be honest, at first I wasn't sure I could set it up on the wall without a great deal of work. All the features on this phone are quite useful and easy to program. Excellent price, by the way! Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. FERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Phone works well.  Display is battery powered
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the phone for a couple of years, and this phone has worked well and been reliable. An advantage (but a disadvantage for some) is that the display is battery powered.
customer_reviews.author: savvybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Can't use both headset and speakerphone
customer_reviews.text: If the headset is plugged in, the speakerphone doesn't work. For me this is a major operational problem. So 3* rating.
customer_reviews.author: E-consumer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Integrated Corded Landline Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone more than meets my expectations. I use it for my part time call center job which requires the use of a noise reduction headset. This phone was the right price and it had the features that I required in a landline phone.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria C. Whittaker-driver

customer_reviews.title: The speaker phone works great! It has an input for a headset
customer_reviews.text: The speaker phone works great! It has an input for a headset. I cannot figure out how to program the clock? When I was talking to a support line using the speaker phone they were having a hard time understanding me though? It has three settings for the ringer; loud, soft and off. It also has a red light up in the right hand corner that illuminates when there is a call. The price is right!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Domenick's Opinion
customer_reviews.text: I bought the phone as I wanted one with a headset jack. I was pleasantly surprised to fing it had so much versatility with ten one touch buttons in addition to the speed dial options and a huge storage for phone numbers. The phone works great, with headphones it works great, and the speakerphone works great! It even has rudimentary music on the Hold function which surprised the heck out of my friends. great phone at a great price. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Domenick

customer_reviews.title: Yet to be used, but has what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It has a headset port, which is what I was looking for. The picture of the phone that I was looking at was white. When it arrived and I opened it, I discovered it was black. Kinda weird to see the color change, but beyond that I am pleased. As always, excellent shipping from Amazon along with good timelines for estimated product arrival. I can't say about the quality of the phone as I have yet to use it, life got in the way, all I can say is that it's hard to find a phone with a headset port (home business).
customer_reviews.author: Connie Harmon

customer_reviews.title: does the job but feels old fashioned
customer_reviews.text: it's not easy to find a corded phone with speakerphone, caller ID and no answering machine. Most people I know say Panasonic is good so wanted that brand. it's got a cheap look, oldfashioned design and the screen view reminds me of a computer monitor view from the 80s. it needs 3 batteries so hopefully they last. but, u only need the batteries for caller id, speed dialing and redial - not for speakerphone.
customer_reviews.author: cotton clay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product & Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an affordable phone that I could use with a plug in headset for work. My order arrived VERY quickly and is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KiaStar

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: Received this phone and I set it up in my office. The first thing I noticed was that the clock could not be set. The "OK" button did not work. After waiting for this phone I had to return it and go to a store near me and get a phone. I needed it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great Desk Phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sized and many featured phone. In particular it has music on hold,a headset connection, call waiting caller ID,uses batteries rather than an external charger, and can match an incoming caller ID to its internal phone book. All these features make it a great phone to have on your office deck.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Helman

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine, clear
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a new landline to do 800# conference calls while working from home. Seems to work fine, clear, easy to read controls. Needs 3 AA batteries for the display to work... time, date, letting you know it is on MUTE--- so I think you want to put in the batteries. Not a bright display... black on gray crystal, not lighted... Easy to read buttons on the phone..... Has a jack for a headphone, but I have just been using speaker phone. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Valley Guy

customer_reviews.title: Has all the features I need and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Has all the features i needed in a desk phone. Port for headphones, speaker phone button... mute... redial... multiple number storage... only think I dont like is this display which requires batteries... seems to go through batteries quickly and the display is not so useful to me... but other than that... seems to work well for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We have been using it for several months ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We have been using it for several months and it has been sufficient for our needs. The phone cord from handset to base is a bit tight, but I suppose it will loosen up in time. Four stars because it would have been better if the base had been weighted. Since the cord is tight it pulls on the base. Of course, if you are going to mount it on the wall, this might not be such a problem.
customer_reviews.author: 3in1

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of this phone is tinny and absolutely terrible. Because I bought it to use when I hanged to Verizon Home Phone service, I don't really know if that is the fault of the instrument or the service.I will probably try replacing it with a better quality (read: more expensive) phone to see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: gapeach

customer_reviews.title: It's like whatever processing inside is not up to the task ...
customer_reviews.text: We've found that the pushbutton function is erratic. Sometimes, there is a delay in the tone after you push the button. Also, the button that you push to clear old calls from the call register sometimes works and sometimes does not. It's like whatever processing inside is not up to the task of converting mechanical inputs to electronic actions. Very disappointed in this phone considering it's a Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: OC192

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I dont like that you cant just press the speaker button to answer or make a call without 1st lifting the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, a little frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pretty technically savvy person in general. I could not/have not been able to set the time & date. Its not particularly necessary for me, so I've just given up. Other than that frustration (yes, I followed the directions, to the letter, multiple times) it does what I need, and i love the ability to have a speaker phone in my room while i wait on hold.
customer_reviews.author: gnatmo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I have no idea why anyone would rate this low. I was a bit worried after seeing the reviews but I love Panasonic products and was not disappointed. Speaker phone is loud and clear. It has the features I want. I didn't like that it has batteries but I have had the phone for two months now and have not had to change them. I talk on speaker for about 25 hours a week - it uses very little battery power. Great phone.
customer_reviews.author: John Stumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic  KX-TS880B Corded Telephone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. I had a minor issue with one that I ordered and had to return it because I thought it was defective. Amazon readily replaced the phone with a new one. I had the same issue with the replaced one. When I searched on the Internet to determine what I was doing incorrectly I found that I had to very carefully read the instructions. There is a difference between a menu item with and without a "?" question mark.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller's Action

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Functions just as advertised. UPDATE 03/07/2017: THIS PHONE STILL WORKING EXCEPT FOR THE REDIAL, PAUSE BUTTONS. SPEAKERPHONE IS NOT LOUD ENOUGH AND THE HOLD MUSIC IS HORRIBLE. STILL DOES THE BASICS AND WORKS WELL WITH MY PLANTRONICS HANDSET LIFTER AND WIRELESS HEADSET. LOOKING TO UPGRADE THE PHONE TO SOMETHING WITH A BETTER SPEAKERPHONE AT LEAST
customer_reviews.author: CHAZ

customer_reviews.title: Calling Line ID and Message Indicator failure
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked well except for poor contrast on screen and Calling Line ID and Message Indicator failures. Ordered new AT&T CL2940 and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: coolf209

customer_reviews.title: OMG this is soooo much better than the AT&T 17929 that I bought on here
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is soooo much better than the AT&T 17929 that I bought on here. The volume and clarity through my headset is a million times better on this!! The only negative is the display (which is NOT lit) runs on batteries vs. a plug. Normally I wouldn't care if the display was lit but it also controls the ability to pick up a call from my headset vs. the handset and that I must have. So I will be stocking up on AA's.
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Volume is Weak
customer_reviews.text: The speaker volume is too weak. Otherwise it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer John Zambrano

customer_reviews.title: BUT the phone itself is a classic phone that looks great on a desk
customer_reviews.text: I got a lemon when I ordered this phone (why it is 3 stars). It literally did not work as far as voicemail, caller id, etc. (Amazon saved the day and all is well), BUT the phone itself is a classic phone that looks great on a desk. Assuming all functions work well, it seems like it would be a nice addition to an office.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic used to make quality products :(
customer_reviews.text: The sound seems clear but I can't set the time/date because the ok button won't work. Also found out that there is no dial tone without the batteries. My 10 year old Panasonic will still work without batteries. I use the phone for work so decided not to ask for a replacement. I'm sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The phone works good but the only thing I dislike about the phone is that the speaker sounds like a tweeter
customer_reviews.author: Marco E.

customer_reviews.title: Switching between headset and handset is impossible without unplugging headset.
customer_reviews.text: Considering a return. When you plug in a headset, the only way that you can hear the call is via the headset. Idiotic. Handset is automatically disabled...
customer_reviews.author: mikro88

customer_reviews.title: Low audio volume, even at highest setting
customer_reviews.text: I bought 50 of these things for my company and found that the volume level is really low on these phones. Overall the phone itself is made well but the audio level even at the highest setting is borderline useless. Will not order them again.
customer_reviews.author: MADPokerKing

customer_reviews.title: Phone itself works fine, but the "OK" button doesn't do anything
customer_reviews.text: Phone itself works fine, but the "OK" button doesn't do anything, so it's not able to be programmed. Stands up high enough on my desk that I can read the caller info or time at a quick glance. Buttons are easy to push quickly -- not like on some phones where they need to practically be jammed in.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only about 1yr
customer_reviews.text: I had always respected panasonic for their quality... and years ago they were the best of phones. I am disappointed Not sure what has happened but this one did not last After about a year the keypad started to fail where it would not put out the tones for AVR systems to get through the typical menus that we are all accustom to these days.... They must have gone to cheaper parts...
customer_reviews.author: K. Bard

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. Good sound quality and the people on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this phone with a cheap headset for conference calls, and it works great. Good sound quality and the people on the other end tell me they can hear me perfectly as well. The speaker phone also has good sound quality. All in all, especially considering it was MUCH cheaper than anything else I found in stores, this has been a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this phone but the "ok" button didn't work ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone but the "ok" button didn't work so it couldn't be programed even after much time with customer support. I returned it and got a second one. The same problem. I'm NOT trying a third time. It's unfortunate since all my other phones are Panasonic's and work well. I would NOT buy this phone.
customer_reviews.author: B Blandford

customer_reviews.title: Headset top quality
customer_reviews.text: Used for call center work from home. Phone meets needs satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: dwatson

customer_reviews.title: Speakerphone does not pick up voice effectively
customer_reviews.text: Its probably better than the 2 stars I gave it. However, I wanted to use it pretty much exclusively as a speakerphone and it just does not pick up my voice unless I am very close to the phone.
customer_reviews.author: James B Van Laar

customer_reviews.title: Older Model Panasonic is much better Quality for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone has very low dial sounds. I am not sure if I have hit the correct number or not. Not having an indicator that you are using a headset (a light) or speaker is confusing and frustrating. I was replacing an older model Panasonic that had all of those features and more. Extremely disappointed with the quality of this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Pennington

customer_reviews.title: the phone just stopped working, no sound on the ...
customer_reviews.text: the phone just stopped working, no sound on the handset or the speaker, and it has been less than a year since the purchase. I called support as it is still under the 1 year mfg warranty and I would need to pay for shipping back to them, then wait 7 days before I could call and get a status update, then wait for it to be fixed or replaced and sent back. Most places would send a new phone and pay for sending the broken one back. This is my office line, so waiting that long is not an option.
customer_reviews.author: SherryB

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in April 2018 and here it is January 2019 and it does not work. I should not be surprised though. Anything Panasonic I purchased was a piece of junk. Microwave oven, DVD player, VCR from back in the day. Wouldn't last.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: The Panasonic exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: The phone was just what was advertized and works perfectly. It has all the features it was supposed to have and all work well. I am very pleased. The seller was awesome. I got the phone a day earlier than they said it would be and total time was only three days! Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Rondd

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this item
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this product. I purchased 1 and after less than week handset quit working, they sent me another one and 45 days later same thing happened. can's get refund and will never buy Panasonic item again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Robilio

customer_reviews.title: Very nice landline phone
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone. It's not too huge, but all functions are clearly readable and there are some nice features. Only two things I would change: you have to pick up the handset to deploy the speakerphone (odd), and the responsiveness to speed-dial and other function buttons is a little slow.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: A high quality corded phone with all the basic features. The caller-id will work with rechargeable batteries, but the instructions call for alkaline batteries, otherwise the battery indicator constantly flashes. The sound is more clear than AT&T model it replaced. Overall, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle_Al

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The product never fully worked. Some of the buttons never functioned so I cannot fully set up the phone. I did not find out about the buttons not functioning until I had discard the box so could not return. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J Justin Berta

customer_reviews.title: Basic phone that works.
customer_reviews.text: It's a basic phone that works well for what it is. Believe it or not, I bought this for my office, when the 20-something year old one provided (surprise) stopped working (I work in academia...we're broke and have to buy our own stuff). It does the trick when I need to have a conference call, and didn't cost me an arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.author: MCV

customer_reviews.title: Good design business phone.  Poor English instruction manual.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good design corded phone. ( Large LCD display panel. ) 😁 Cons: Bad instruction manual for clock setting.( 3 AA batteries needed.) 😬
customer_reviews.author: Satoshi

customer_reviews.title: It was great for three months
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful phone and I loved using it for the first three months. After that, folks kept asking me to speak up and even if I yelled, they complained they could not hear me very well. Since it is still under warranty, I have the option to send it in at my cost and wait 4 to 6 weeks for the repair. This is not good customer service! I have bought many Panasonic products in the past but this one will be the last.
customer_reviews.author: Back in the Holler'

customer_reviews.title: Solid, reliable desk phone with good headset options.
customer_reviews.text: very good phone, with the only limitation is the batteries for the Caller ID function. Plus is the batteries are not required to use the phone and they last a good long time. Good Speaker Phone. Headset Jack is well placed and not a normal feature for most desk phones. Works well with a Plantronics HL-10 lifter for headset use. Nice three position stand for low, high, and wall mount that has the phone a decent distance from the wall without making it an obstacle. Basically the same quality of Panasonic that I have come to expect at a reasonable price. Good Value.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Desk phone
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to have a phone with landline in basement shop. Instructions were hard to understand, but we finally got some of it set up.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Woody

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: Lousy phone- poor sound from the speaker and when talking people could not hear me. I went with the ATT and was much happier. Display was nice though and easily read.
customer_reviews.author: Laser man

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift the previous year, and she loved it. She says the sound quality is great and that it is still worked excellently.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting Item
customer_reviews.text: As per following email I want refund. The phone set is not working properly since day one. I finally purchased another set from Walmart way less in price and more efficient as compare to price chart.
customer_reviews.author: sonia saha

customer_reviews.title: Hangup switch went bad
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the phone, but the hangup switch went bad in 2 weeks. It would not hang up, and I had to disconnect the telephone cord to stop the busy signal. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Keene

customer_reviews.title: I use this for long teleconference calls and I could not be happier with this phone
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new landline phone with headset and speakerphone options. I use this for long teleconference calls and I could not be happier with this phone. I also bought the Panasonic KX-TCA60 headset and the sound clarity is great.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Corded Desk Phone
customer_reviews.text: I like my corded desk phone so well that I ordered a spare. I have portable phones but like my desk phone best. Thanks for having them.
customer_reviews.author: Camelot 40

product_meta.title: Panasonic KX-TS880B Integrated Corded Telephone,Black
product_meta.description: Quickly dial frequently called phone numbers! Make life easier with the Single-Line Corded Integrated Phone System with 10 One-Touch Dialer Stations. Store frequently called numbers for one-touch dialing. Hang it on a wall to free up desk or counter space. Perfect for kitchens!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars591 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
